oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Numerical methods for the extended Fisher-Kolmogorov (EFK) equation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DANUMJAYA, P
PANI, AK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: velocity selection
marginal stability
extended fisher-kolmogorov (efk) equation
lyapunov functional
weak solution
existence
uniqueness and regularity results
finite element method
semidiscrete method
backward euler
two step backward difference and crank-nicolson schemes
optimal estimates
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the study of pattern formation in bi-stable systems, the extended Fisher-Kolmogorov (EFK) equation plays an important role. In this paper, some a priori bounds are proved using Lyapunov functional. Further, existence, uniqueness and regularity results for the weak solutions are derived. Using C-1-conforming finite element method, optimal error estimates are established for the semidiscrete case. Finally, fully discrete schemes like backward Euler, two step backward difference and Crank-Nicolson methods are proposed, related optimal error estimates are derived and some computational experiments are discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF NUMERICAL ANALYSIS AND MODELING, 3(2), 186-210
